page.title: 19S. CENTRAL MENDIP:APPRAISAL
page.content: The Survey lies largely within the Mendip Hills area of{Outstanding {Natural Beauty}as designated in{1972. The block still retains in large measure a very unspoiled character despite the increasing pressure on our countryside and the rapid{increase}of {population}in North Somerset since 1961. The work carried out during the Domesday Survey has shown a wide variety of activity and land use but has also reinforced the need to care responsibly for our natural heritage and Conservation work since World War 2 is paying dividends. People were therefore,{'environmentally aware'}but still recognised the importance of local jobs in a time of economic recession even if those jobs are in an {'environmentally destructive'}activity like quarrying.
